required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Injectable Platelet-Rich Fibrin for the Treatment of Temporomandibular Joint Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Injectable Platelet-Rich Fibrin for the Treatment of Temporomandibular Joint Osteoarthritis: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The authors designed a randomized, controlled, double-blind clinical trial after the ethical approval by the University Ethics Committee. The patients with temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJ-OA) randomly assigned one of the two treatment groups: intra-articular injection of injectable platelet-rich fibrin (i-PRF) after arthrocentesis procedure as i-PRF group and arthrocentesis procedure alone as control group. The primary outcome variable was pain levels at preoperatively, and postoperatively at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month. The secondary outcome variables included maximum mouth opening (MMO), lateral and protrusive movements.

detailed_description.textblock:
The authors designed a randomized, controlled, double-blind clinical trial after the ethical approval by the University Ethics Committee. The patients with TMJ-OA randomly assigned one of the two treatment groups: intra-articular injection of i-PRF after arthrocentesis procedure as i-PRF group and arthrocentesis procedure alone as control group. All treatment procedures were completed by the same experienced surgeon under the local anesthesia. The procedure of arthrocentesis was performed using the standard technique and after arthrocentesis procedure, the i-PRF injection was performed in the test group.
The primary outcome variable was pain levels at preoperatively, and postoperatively at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month. The secondary outcome variables included maximum mouth opening (MMO), lateral and protrusive movements.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at preoperatively, and postoperatively at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month
primary_outcome.description: Pain level was measured with a visual analog scale (VAS) before treatment, and at postoperative follow-up (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at preoperatively, and postoperatively at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum mouth opening was assessed by measuring the distance between the incisal border of upper and lower central incisors

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at preoperatively, and postoperatively at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month
secondary_outcome.description: Lateral movement was measured from the labioincisal contact between upper central incisors to the same point of lower central incisors

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at preoperatively, and postoperatively at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th month
secondary_outcome.description: Protrusive movement was measured from the incisal border of upper central incisors to same point of lower central incisors

arm_group.description: arthrocentesis procedure plus four consecutive intra-articular injection of i-PRF.

intervention.description: Arthrocentesis procedure with 2 to 3 mL saline solution to lavage the superior compartment of temporomandibular joint.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with osteoarthritis (OA) of one or two temporomandibular joint (TMJ)
- maximum mouth opening less than 35 mm
- impeded protrusive and lateral movements
- localized pain of the affected joint
Exclusion Criteria:
- systemic or malignant diseases affecting TMJ-OA assessment
- previous invasive or surgical treatments of TMJ unrelated to OA
- edentulous patients
- pregnancy
